message.body: Hi!
hi! how's it going?
All right, stuck in traffic (I'm not driving :D)
How are you?
Pretty good. I just got stuck in the rain on my way home.
How did you hear about this research?
I can't even remember actually! I think someone I know posted it on Facebook? What about you?
Someone from my department posted it :) I'm always willing to help out researchers :)
That's cool. Are you a researcher too?
I'm doing my phd in history and have always relied on the kindness of sources :) how about you?
Ah, I was a history major in undergrad!
Now I do grassroots fundraising and organizing work with a high school student union across the city to fight for public education.
But sources are still important.. i recently used a rad article about fundraising during the birmingham bus boycott as a teaching aide with students
Ah that is awesome! I just took an online course through the acumen fund called "storytelling for change." I'm trying to make my academic talks and class
Oh wow, that's cool! Was the online course good?
I want to do a training with this group called the Center for Story based strategy, but I haven't gotten the chance yet
So what can someone like me do to support public education?
room lectures more engaging.
good question!
if you are in Pennsylvania, I'd say call your senator and ask them to roll back the proposed budget for next year
but you are probably not in PA
generally, you can pressure state officials to fund schools more, as many states are cutting back on teachers, & putting more police in schools to make up

It was great! I can email you the materials if you want. Accountability was tough because my group was split between US, UAE/Canada and Europe. But we google hangouted and I learned useful strategies. Some of the advice seemed a bit over the top but I think you just calibrate to your industry. Also it wasa good excuse to see an old friend every week and make a new one :)
Ugh police instead of teachers? That is horrible. All right I will do one thing for education in new jersey this week.
oh and you can donate money to groups like Philadelphia Student Union ;)
that's great! glad to hear it.
and I would love the handouts actually, if you wouldn't mind emailing them to me..
Ok I'll email/donate when I get home. Still on the rainy road :(
Have you had many other chat comvos/ any idea what they are trying to figure out here?
I'm not sure! I've only had two other chat convos. What about you?
*three
cool
I've has thee, two with the same person and one where there was no response :)
Hahaha that longer response didn't go through before. My cell reception at home isn't so great :)
Ha! Makes more sense now.
What type of history do you study / research?
Hahaha I was like "one word response?!?"
Social justice in indian intellectual history
In particular arguing that a writer named Ismat Chughtai created a theory of social justice based on economic justice, sexual justice and social justicein a multi religious context.
It's tough to summarize research in a compelling way :/
whoa! that sounds really cool!
are there any english translations of Ismat Chughtai's writing that you'd recommend?
Hahaha thanks, now to actually write the dissertation :)

Yes for sure! Her most famous story "The Quilt" is available in translation. She was tried for obscenity in 1946 because this story relates a sexual relationship between two women. I love her autobiography which has recently been translated with the title "a life in words"
Oh! I think my best friend - who teaches global women's literature classes - told me about 'The Quilt'
I will read that one first, then find the autobiography
Thank you for the recommendations...

Yes, it has definitely made an impact -- the point of my work is to incorporate it into a broader story about the possibilities for leftist progressive intellectuals from Muslim backgrounds in south Asia. Expanding possibilities for what it means to be Muslim in south Asia.
That is great though! I should always refer to the quilt since it does seem to be a point of reference sometimes. Where does your friend teach?
Yeah sure, my life basically revolves around this writer right now so I'm happy to spread the word :)
Are you hopeful about the future of public education in America?
She teaches at Temple University.
Huh, that is a good question. I want to be hopeful. I'm not sure if I am though.
Well, I feel hopeful when I see the inspiring work that high school students are doing. But we are up against some real powerful enemies...
There was an article in the Philadelphia Inquirer yesterday that revealed that the Governor wants to turn over the whole School District of Phila to charters..
So I am feeling especially despondent right now, as it happens.
:( I'll try to read that article... There's a lot of debate concerning higher education as well. I feel like somewhere along the way our society forgot about the point of education.
Have you thought about writing an op Ed in response?
No I hadn't thought about it.. But that's a good idea!
What are the debates about concerning higher ed?
Btw, this is by far the mostly interesting of these convos that I've had ;)
Same here :) so re: the op Ed. You should do it! You are an expert in this field and can highlight the work of your org. Awesome people are needed in nat
ional discourse. Also since That article just came out this would be the perfect time.

Re: higher Ed, there is a lot of hype around online education and I'm afraid were about to see the corporatization of higher Ed where only some studentsget in person instruction and everyone else gets cookie cutter programs :(
I can't remember where I heard this first but I believe we've shifted from a society with a capitalist economy to a society in service of capitalist economics.
Which is why I'm trying to shift the societal conversation towards justice. Let's see what impact I have :)
